item.title: LEGO Game Boy Kits Have Released Early
item.description:
The LEGO Game Boy set has broken its October 1 release date, as some Sam's Club shoppers noticed palettes of the crossover set between LEGO and Nintendo were already available in person. Additionally, the LEGO Game Boy sets sold at Sam's Club are discounted by $10 off the standard $59.99 MSRP, though availability is likely to vary.

The LEGO Game Boy is inspired by Nintendo's historic handheld console, and is officially listed as a 1-to-1 scale recreation of the system. The original gray Game Boy console first hit store shelves in 1989, and came bundled with Tetris as a pack-in game in North America and Europe. Between well-known titles like Pokemon Red and Blue , The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening , and lesser-known hidden gems like Kid Dracula , the Game Boy helped place Nintendo's handheld console business on the map. Despite its discontinuation in 2001, some of Game Boy's best games can still be played via the Nintendo Switch Online service.

LEGO Game Boy Sets Are Available Three Weeks Early

Months after Nintendo gave fans a first look at the LEGO Game Boy set, the anticipated kit has arrived a few weeks ahead of schedule at one retailer. As reported by Wario64 on Twitter and Reddit user Dmtry on the official LEGO subreddit, the LEGO Game Boy set has essentially broken the October 1 release date and is available for purchase at various Sam's Club retail locations across the US. Additionally, the LEGO Game Boy sets sold at Sam's Club are discounted by $10, from the original $59.99 MSRP down to $49.99. However, purchasing a LEGO Game Boy set via Sam's Club comes with some caveats. The sets can only be purchased at physical retail Sam's Club stores, which in turn requires a membership to shop at. Sam's Club memberships start at $50 per year.

Given that the available inventory at Sam's Club stores is subject to change, customers' mileage may vary in scoring a LEGO Game Boy set. Compared to the $1,000 LEGO Star Wars Death Star set, also set to arrive in October, the discounted price of the 421-piece LEGO Game Boy may be enticing to some enthusiasts. On social media, fans corroborated what was posted on Twitter and Reddit; however, some reported issues with Sam's Club not having the LEGO Game Boy sets in its inventory system as of writing.

Alternatively, shoppers not near a Sam's Club store can still pre-order a LEGO Game Boy set via the official LEGO website. It remains to be seen how Nintendo and LEGO will respond to Sam's Club breaking the street date of the Game Boy set.

item.title: Marvel Rivals May Be Getting Loot Boxes
item.description:
New information discovered in the files for Marvel Rivals suggests that the popular Marvel hero shooter may soon be planning to add loot boxes to the game. The Marvel shooter took the gaming world by storm following its high-profile release late last year, becoming one of the hottest shooters in the gaming community with millions of players. Marvel Rivals reportedly boasted 10 million players within just a few days of its launch, with fans quickly flocking to the game across multiple devices. Now, a major new type of monetization may soon be coming to Rivals .

Marvel Rivals ' success has been owed in part to NetEase's support for the game since its release and the frequent new content updates. Marvel Rivals currently boasts 41 different characters for players to choose from, with another two characters set to join the playable roster following the release of Season 4. Rivals ' most recent Season 3 added a pair of popular Marvel characters to the game during the summer, with X-Men 's Phoenix and beloved hero Blade joining the cast. A new update is now hinting at the addition of loot boxes to Marvel Rivals .

A new post shared by popular Marvel Rivals account RivalsInfo suggests that NetEase Games is planning to add loot boxes to Marvel Rivals . According to the post, Season 4's files feature references to "Mysteries" as a player component, confirmed to be the in-development codename for loot boxes in Marvel Rivals . The datamine also features further references to an older loot box system in Rivals , including the "cosmic mysteries number" among others. The post did not share any details about a potential release date for Marvel Rivals ' loot boxes beyond being featured in Season 4's files.

Marvel Rivals May Be Adding Loot Boxes

The addition of loot boxes to Marvel Rivals will likely be a controversial change for many fans of the Marvel shooter. Loot boxes have often been a hot-button issue among both gamers and parents, with many viewing loot boxes as nothing more than an alternative form of gambling. The prominence of loot boxes within online games has even seen several national governments taking legal action against game developers, with countries like Australia requiring games featuring loot boxes to be given an M rating.

The rumored Marvel Rivals loot boxes come as NetEase has revealed plenty on the way for the game's fourth competitive season. Season 4 will introduce two new Heroes for player to acquire in Marvel Rivals , with Angela launching alongside Season 4 on September 12 and Daredevil debuting with the season's second half in October 2025. Season 4 will also add several new game types to Marvel Rivals ' Arcade mode, debuting challenges like "Conquest (Annihilation)" and "Free Fight." Marvel Rivals ' new season looks to have lots of exciting content coming alongside the potential introduction of loot boxes.

item.title: Best Metroidvanias For Feeling Like A God
item.description:
Power in Metroidvanias is earned, not granted. Through deliberate exploration and ability progression, the genre offers a rare transformation, from fragile survivor to an unstoppable force. And in the best games in the genre, that progression can lead the player down a path where their toolkit expands not just in utility, but in spectacle, turning basic traversal and combat into feats of domination.

Many games take the barriers away, letting players unleash their full potential with an onslaught of attacks and abilities that shred through everything in their path, leaving nothing alive once everything is said and done. This power fantasy is hard to achieve, but when done correctly, the resulting satisfaction is pretty hard to beat.

Record Of Lodoss War: Deedlit In Wonder Labyrinth

Complete Mastery Of The Elements

Record of Lodoss War -Deedlit in Wonder Labyrinth-
Action
Systems
Released
March 12, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity, Simulated Gambling
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Elemental control is the centerpiece of Record of Lodoss War . By endgame, switching between fire and wind spirits grants both invulnerability and amplified attacks, allowing players to bypass hazards and nullify entire enemy types, turning them into a mobile force that can barely be stopped.

Combat and movement fuse into a seamless loop of floaty precision, and every input feels meaningful at all times. Attacks become omnidirectional, and traversal evolves into a dance of moves, as the player becomes a spectral juggernaut, untouched and ready to take on anything.

Guacamelee!

Lucha Libre Godhood Unleashed

Guacamelee!
7.3 /10
Released
April 9, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
DrinkBox Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PS3, Nintendo Wii U, PS Vita, Xbox 360, Linux
Powered by

What begins as a charming brawler rapidly transforms into one of the most viscerally powerful Metroidvania experiences available. Juan’s combat starts simple, but each ability unlock builds toward a feeling of overwhelming strength.

By endgame, the player becomes a whirlwind of unrelenting pressure, as enemies and hazards fold under their combo chains and instant-recovery dodges. The combat becomes an explosive thrill-ride that leans heavily into the overpowered end of the scale, leaving the player feeling like a deity-level threat with nothing to stop them.

Ender Lilies: Quietus Of The Knights

Divine Judgment Wielded Through Others

Ender Lilies: Quietus of the Knights
8 /10
Released
January 21, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Live Wire, Adglobe
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

In Ender Lilies , the player starts weak but quickly becomes a force of sacred destruction. The strength lies in the spirits that the player commands, as once-defeated enemies turned into avatars of vengeance. As the collection grows, so does the variety and devastation of attacks, ranging from swift blades to monstrous cannon blasts.

The game’s somber, holy atmosphere enhances the godlike transformation. What starts as a journey through ruin turns into an adventure full of power and might in the hands of the player, and despite the delicate nature of the protagonist, they still hold plenty of destructive capabilities in their arsenal.

Metroid Dread

Become A Mechanical Destroyer

Metroid Dread
8.5 /10
Released
October 8, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Animated Blood, Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
MercurySteam
Platform(s)
Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Metroid Dread opens with Samus hunted, restrained, and weakened, but as upgrades compound, her movement and firepower become unmatched. Sliding through tight corridors, executing instant counters, and blasting through enemies feels less like progression and more like an ascension to something more, as the player becomes something to be feared.

By the finale, Samus operates on instinct and efficiency. Enemies no longer pose a threat, and they exist only to be dismantled. The final ability, an uncontrollable surge of Metroid DNA, cements her godhood in the game, and the world around the player is no longer a maze but a kill zone.

Blasphemous 2

Stylized Action That Never Disappoints

Blasphemous 2
9.0 /10
Released
August 24, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Violence
Developer(s)
The Game Kitchen
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Switch, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Blasphemous 2 feeds into the godlike playstyle slowly and procedurally. Players begin with one of three weapons, struggling to traverse through certain areas, but after a few hours of battling, they soon become a force to be reckoned with that has very little that can put them down.

Toward the end of the game, what really elevates the godlike state is the battles against deity-level entities, where the player is clashing blades with enemies on an equal power level to themselves. When all is said and done, nothing can even lift a finger to the player's insane strength, both in their melee combat and overall destructive capabilities.

Nine Sols

So Much Power And Mobility In One Tiny Body

Nine Sols
9.0 /10
Released
May 29, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
RedCandleGames
Platform(s)
PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Nine Sols is easily one of the best metroidvanias released in the past few years and perhaps of all time. What makes the game so great is the blending of mechanics from parries to dashes, which, when combined, allow the player to fight everything and anything in a ballet-style dance of blades.

Players start their journey with no tools at all, but after just a few hours, things start to ramp up with extra dashes and combos to decimate enemies with style. And, when taking on the tougher bosses, the satisfaction is insane from every precise input needed to clear the fights. By the end, players feel like an inevitable hero with godlike powers, ready to take on the final barrier before their story ends.

Axiom Verge

Twisted Technology That Transcends Humanity

Axiom Verge
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
March 31, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Thomas Happ Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS Vita, Switch, Nintendo Wii U, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Axiom Verge thrusts players into the role of Trace, whose upgrades turn them into something beyond human, rewriting environments, phasing through walls, and reprogramming enemies. Every tool feels subversive, breaking the rules of the game’s reality and turning the player into a force that isn't afraid to break down walls.

By the final hours, Trace is less an explorer and more a system administrator of the world itself. His arsenal doesn’t just kill, but it alters existence, and where others platform, he rewrites the world, mastering it with perfection.

Ori And The Will Of The Wisps

Graceful Movement That Feels More Godlike Than Grounded

Ori and the Will of the Wisps
9 /10
7.8 /10
Released
March 11, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Mild Fantasy, Violence
Developer(s)
Moon Studios
Platform(s)
Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Switch, PC
Powered by

Ori’s ascent to power is not about raw destruction, but perfect movement. With each ability learned, the character becomes increasingly frictionless, and the game evolves from platformer to art form, where combat and traversal blend into one seamless motion.

In the end, Ori is untouchable not because of his defense or insane attack moves, but because nothing can catch him. Chaining abilities across obstacles and enemies becomes second nature, creating a fluidity few games can match, and as players glide through areas with elegance and excellence, they truly transcend the organic world into something otherworldly.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Free Dice Roll Links (Updated Daily)
item.description:
Monopoly GO is a fun board game that combines the classic Monopoly experience with cool additional features and a city-building element. In the game, players can move their pieces to earn money and then use that money to build new buildings, upgrade their houses, and much more. The ultimate goal is to drive other players into bankruptcy by acquiring all pieces of property, essentially creating a “monopoly.”

In Monopoly GO , players move according to the number of dice they get, and the game proceeds with renting, trading, and buying properties. If players have finished their dice rolls and want to get some more, here’s how they can do it.

Updated by Umama Ali on Sep 07, 2025: Without dice, you can’t roll around the board, build landmarks, or participate in any tournaments. Running out of dice can slow down your progress in Monopoly GO, leaving you at a disadvantage compared to other players. With the release of Roll Drop, players are looking for more dice links. We’ve updated this guide with a bunch of new links that offer free dice rolls so that you can keep building in Monopoly GO. Check back regularly to find new Monopoly GO dice links.

We didn't find any new dice links on Sep 07 . You can find all the active Monopoly GO dice links in the table below.

Free Monopoly GO Dice Links For Today

While your dice rolls slowly replenish over time, you can use Dice Links to get free dice rolls instantly. Dice Links are a quick and easy way to grab free dice and keep the action going in Monopoly GO . Here are all the active Monopoly GO dice links for September 2025 to help you participate in ongoing events and tournaments and complete boards easily.
Monopoly GO Dice Links Date
25 x Dice Rolls Sep 05 - Sep 08
30 x Dice Rolls Sep 05 - Sep 12
25 x Dice Rolls Sep 02 - Sep 03
25 x Dice Rolls Sep 03 - Sep 04

  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls

  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls

How to Redeem Dice Links in Monopoly GO

To redeem these links, tycoons can follow these simple steps:
  • Open a link on your phone. This will launch the Monopoly GO app on your device.
  • All you need to do then is click 'Collect,' and you'll get dice rolls for free.

How To Get Free Dice Rolls In Monopoly Go

Login Daily

Like most mobile games nowadays, Monopoly GO also offers incentives for players so that they frequently play the game. One of the daily treats is free dice rolls, so logging in daily is one way to get them. In addition to dice rolls, players have the chance to win other exciting prizes as well.

Invite Friends

Monopoly GO offers generous rewards for players who successfully invite others to join the game. If a player invites a friend, and the invited friend joins the game, both of them get 30 extra rolls . Players can keep getting 30 free rolls for inviting up to 30 friends , given that they accept the invitation.

Collect Community Chest Rewards

Community chests are great because they offer a variety of rewards. Players can open these chests to earn money, and if they help a friend with a community chest, they can earn some free rolls.
To make the most out of the community chest, players must ensure that they have at least 9 active in-game friends.

Complete Sticker Albums

Players collect stickers throughout Monopoly GO , and they aren’t just a fun part of the game; they can help players get dice rolls , too. For every sticker set or album that players complete, they receive dice rolls. While the free rolls earned through sticker albums are more than those obtained after completing a set, the process of completing an album can be more time-consuming.
small
Related

Monopoly GO: How to Play and Win the Partner Event

Partner Event is a popular social event in Monopoly GO that allows tycoons to team up with their friends. Here’s everything you need to know about it.

Participate in Events and Tournaments

If you want a bunch of dice rolls, consider participating in events and tournaments. The game introduces new events regularly, and by completing their milestones, you can claim dice rolls, different sticker packs, in-game money, and various other exciting prizes . Tournaments also pack a lot of stellar rewards, so players should aim to secure a high position on the tournament leaderboard to make the most of them.

Special Events

Apart from the main events and tournaments, Monopoly GO also has a number of special events. From Free Parking to Wheel Boost, the game offers many events to help you grab some dice rolls. However, their timings change every day, so you can check out our daily events schedule guide to know when they happen.

item.title: Diablo 4 Season 10 Could Be Season 8 All Over Again for One Unique, But There’s an Asterisk Attached
item.description:
The ups and downs of Diablo 4 's balance patches have often left certain pieces of gear in drastically different states from season to season. Some items that have been the cornerstones of meta builds one season can find themselves outclassed by new Uniques or Mythics in the next. The Crown of Lucion has been one of the most inconsistent Uniques in Diablo 4 , but Season 10 could help boost it back to the top of the meta, where it briefly dominated in Season 8.

A lot of Uniques that may not have been useful in past Diablo 4 seasons are set to get a second wind in Season 10 thanks to the new Chaos Armor mechanic. With a pool of Chaos Armor offering the chance for certain Uniques to appear in different gear slots, items that would have been passed over in favor of more powerful alternatives have the chance to work in tandem with them on a different piece of gear. With the Crown of Lucion set to join the pool of potential Chaos Armor drops, players will be able to make use of a devastating combo—as long as it doesn't repeat the Unique's Season 8 performance too closely.

Diablo 4's Crown of Lucion Unique Could See Another Heyday in Season 10

The Crown of Lucion Was So Broken in Season 8 That It Had to Be Removed

Prior to the official start of Diablo 4 Season 8, the PTR was terrorized by the Crown of Lucion, which was able to take advantage of an unintended bug. The Crown of Lucion typically has the following affixes:

  • Crown of Lucion
    • +[489-526] Maximum Life
    • +[8.1-8.8]% Cooldown Reduction
    • +[7.0-8.0]% Lucky Hit Chance
    • +[40.0-50.0]% Shadow Resistance
    • Each time you use a Skill with a Resource Cost, gain [5-15]% increased damage and Resource Cost is increased by 30%[+] for 4 seconds, stacking up to 5 times.

What made this Unique so dangerous in Diablo 4 Season 8's PTR build was that a bug allowed its damage scaling to far exceed what was intended to be possible. As such, builds that could activate the Crown of Lucion's Unique affix with a resource-consuming skill, like the Hydra Sorcerer, could deal unimaginable amounts of damage. Unfortunately, this bug allowed the Crown of Lucion to be so broken that Blizzard deactivated the Unique, making it unusable for Season 8 until a patch could be deployed.

The Crown of Lucion returned to Diablo 4 in Season 9, but couldn't carve out a niche for itself on any of the season's top builds.

Crown of Lucion May Not Be As Broken as in Season 8, But Chaos Armor Could Make It Feel Like It Is

Without this bug to drastically boost the damage output of the Crown of Lucion, the Unique slides back to being a good but not great option as a helm. For Hydra Sorcerers, the better option in the helm slot is the Mythic Harlequin Crest, also known as the Shako, since it has a more broadly applicable affix that grants a 20% damage reduction as well as adds +4 ranks to all skills. However, with the Crown of Lucion in the pool for Chaos Armor, players could potentially use both it and the Shako for a one-two punch of insane damage scaling.

  • Harlequin Crest
    • +20.0% Cooldown Reduction
    • +800 Maximum Life
    • +18 Maximum Resource
    • +350 Armor
    • Gain 20% Damage Reduction. In addition, gain +4 Ranks to all Skills.

The bonus ranks to Hydra that the Shako grants, combined with the massive damage increase the Crown of Lucion offers the player's summoned Hydra from the resource cost needed to summon them, creates a situation where the Hydra Sorcerer builds can get the best of both worlds, when they would otherwise have to choose between one or the other. While the combination of these two items likely won't allow the Crown of Lucion to reach the same heights that required it to be removed from Season 8, it offers a fantastic combo for players to experiment with in Season 10.
